transcription: Patient presents with chest pain radiating to the left arm. ECG shows ST-segment elevation. Diagnosis: Acute myocardial infarction.
Child with persistent fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph nodes. Strep test positive. Diagnosis: Streptococcal pharyngitis.
Patient complains of blurred vision, frequent urination, and unexplained weight loss. Fasting blood glucose elevated. Diagnosis: Type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Severe headache, photophobia, and neck stiffness. Lumbar puncture reveals elevated white blood cells. Diagnosis: Meningitis.
Persistent cough, hemoptysis, and weight loss. Chest X-ray shows a mass in the lung. Diagnosis: Lung cancer.
Joint pain, morning stiffness, and swelling in multiple joints. Positive rheumatoid factor. Diagnosis: Rheumatoid arthritis.
Newborn with jaundice, pale stools, and dark urine. Elevated bilirubin levels. Diagnosis: Neonatal hyperbilirubinemia.
Middle-aged woman with fatigue, hair loss, and cold intolerance. TSH elevated. Diagnosis: Hypothyroidism.
Elderly patient with memory loss, disorientation, and difficulty performing daily tasks. MRI shows hippocampal atrophy. Diagnosis: Alzheimer's disease.
Smoker with chronic cough, sputum production, and wheezing. Spirometry reveals obstructive pattern. Diagnosis: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
Teenager with bone pain, anemia, and elevated alkaline phosphatase. X-rays show lytic lesions. Diagnosis: Osteosarcoma.
Swollen and painful joints, especially in the hands and feet. Morning stiffness lasting more than an hour. Diagnosis: Psoriatic arthritis.
Infant with poor feeding, vomiting, and irritability. Abdominal ultrasound shows hypertrophic pyloric stenosis. Diagnosis: Pyloric stenosis.
Young woman with irregular menstrual cycles, hirsutism, and acne. Elevated testosterone levels. Diagnosis: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
Adult male with sudden weakness on one side of the body, slurred speech, and facial droop. CT scan reveals ischemic stroke. Diagnosis: Ischemic cerebrovascular accident (CVA).
Construction worker with shortness of breath, chest tightness, and wheezing. Peak flow measurements show reversible airflow limitation. Diagnosis: Asthma.
Breast lump, nipple discharge, and skin changes. Mammogram reveals irregular mass. Diagnosis: Invasive ductal carcinoma.
Morning stiffness, joint swelling, and tenderness in the wrists and knees. Positive anti-CCP antibodies. Diagnosis: Rheumatoid arthritis.
Newborn with cyanosis, tachypnea, and heart murmur. Echocardiogram shows ventricular septal defect. Diagnosis: Congenital heart disease.
Obese patient with excessive thirst, frequent urination, and ketonuria. Blood ketones elevated. Diagnosis: Diabetic ketoacidosis.
Middle-aged man with sudden severe headache, vomiting, and altered consciousness. CT scan demonstrates subarachnoid hemorrhage. Diagnosis: Subarachnoid hemorrhage.
Smoker with chronic productive cough, weight loss, and clubbing of fingers. Chest CT reveals cavitary lesions. Diagnosis: Pulmonary tuberculosis.
Skin rash with silvery scales, especially on elbows and knees. Nail pitting. Diagnosis: Psoriasis.
Child with recurrent infections, easy bruising, and petechiae. CBC shows low platelet count. Diagnosis: Immune thrombocytopenic purpura (ITP).
Adult female with fatigue, pallor, and palpitations. Iron studies reveal low ferritin. Diagnosis: Iron-deficiency anemia.
Motor vehicle accident victim with loss of consciousness, confusion, and unequal pupils. CT scan shows epidural hematoma. Diagnosis: Epidural hemorrhage.
Chronic back pain radiating down the leg, aggravated by bending and lifting. MRI shows herniated lumbar disc. Diagnosis: Lumbar disc herniation.
Child with recurrent abdominal pain, bloating, and diarrhea. Positive anti-tTG antibodies. Diagnosis: Celiac disease.
